title: SR-LLM: Rethinking the Structured Representation in Large Language Models
author: Jiahuan Zhang (Westlake University), Tianheng Wang (KMind Technology Co., Ltd.), Hanqing Wu (KMind Technology Co., Ltd.), Ziyi Huang (Westlake University), Yulong Wu (University of Toronto), Dongbai Chen (KMind Technology Co., Ltd.), Linfeng Song (Tencent AI Lab), Yue Zhang (Westlake University), Guozheng Rao (Tianjin University), Kaicheng Yu (Westlake University)
relevance_why: The methods discussed for integrating structured representations into Large Language Models (LLMs) could inspire similar techniques in audio and speech processing models, particularly in representation learning and reasoning.
background: Investigating how structured representations can improve the inference capabilities of Large Language Models across diverse natural language processing tasks.
contribution: This paper introduces the SR-LLM framework to enhance the integration of structured data into LLMs, achieving improved performance on various NLP tasks.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods commonly failed as they directly used structured representations, leading to performance degradations.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work enhances structured representation by translating it into natural language descriptions, allowing for flexible and effective model learning.

key_innovation: Transforms structured representations into natural language formats, making them easier for models to process and understand.
real_world_impact: Offers a promising approach to improve language understanding in AIs, which can be extended to enhance models in audio generation and processing tasks.
limitations: The effectiveness of SR-NLD varies across different LLMs, pointing to possible constraints when applying these methods more broadly.

new_terms.structured representations: **Structured representations** refer to formalized formats like Abstract Meaning Representation (AMR), Parse Syntax Trees (PST), and First-Order Logic (FOL) that define the relationship and components of language data.
new_terms.SR-NLD: **Structured Representation to Natural Language Description** (SR-NLD) is a method proposed in this work to convert structured formats into understandable natural language, improving model interaction with structured data.
